name: Monkey Bread II
author: Darren, Debbie and Joshua
summary: Here is a recipe for a bread machine, though it can easily be done in the conventional, muscle building way. You use the dough only setting and do the rest by hand.  For machines that do 1 1/2 - 2 pound capacity.
directions: Place yeast, flour, ground cinnamon, salt, white sugar, 2 tablespoons butter and water in the order that is recommended for the bread maker
Make sure that no liquid comes in contact with the yeast
Select dough cycle and press start
When dough is complete, place dough on floured surface and knead 10 to 12 times
In a medium saucepan on low heat, melt one cup of butter, stir in brown sugar and raisins ( 1/4 cup of chopped nuts is good too!)
Cut dough in one inch chunks
Drop one chunk at a time into the butter sugar mixture
Thoroughly coat dough pieces, then layer them loosely in a greased Bundt or tube pan, staggering layers so you're plopping each dough chunk over a space between two below
Let rise in a warm, draft-free spot until dough is just over the top of the pan, 15 to 20 minutes
Bake in a preheated 375 degree F (190 degree C) oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till golden brown
Remove from oven, place a plate face down in top of the pan and, using oven mitts to hold plate on pan, turn over both until bread slides out onto plate
